Description: Two side-fragments of a rectangular wooden coffin; painted Hieroglyphic text on plaster; one piece is decorated with an eye-panel and joined to EA47594. And part of the same coffin as EA46663(-584) according to Zitman 2010, 115, 230(II).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Attached to 1907,0511.602 The long boards show ancient repairs. The top of the edges are painted red.
Bibliographic references: Zitman 2010 / The necropolis of Assiut: a case study of local Egyptian funerary culture from the Old Kingdom to the end of the Middle Kingdom (II, 115, 230.)
